channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report E-2024090075
item.description:
Report E-2024090075

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-23
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 23, 2024, three (3) 40-pound bags of calcium peroxide were torn in transit and released approximately thirty (30) pounds of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. GES personnel utilized hand tools to collect the freestanding product. All calcium peroxide impacted material was collected and containerized in four (4) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090082
item.description:
Report E-2024090082

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO CNW, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2-quarts of MIL-PRF-85285F, Type II, Class H High Solid Polyurethane released from (3) 32-ounce metal canisters due to what appears to be a forklift backed into the freight. The release impacted the dock. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller recommended contractor due to PPE requirement of chemical goggles.

item.title: Report X-2024090215
item.description:
Report X-2024090215

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FRA Hazmat Inspector John Powell identified GATX 286323 with residue on exterior of car during an inspection at the BNSF Terminal in Spokane, WA on 8/26/2024. The source appeared to come from the man way area and all man way swing bolts were inspected and found to be tool tight. Upon arrival to the BNSF Railway Pasco, WA Terminal the car was then identified again by BNSF Mechanical who were aware of the prior inspection and removed the man way lid to inspect the gasket. The gasket was identified as an insert gasket on the man way lid but was also identified as deteriorated due to no longer having the compression to allow a complete seal on the nozzle. BNSF Mechanical HM Responders removed the gasket and replaced with a man way nozzle gasket to allow continued movement.

item.title: Report X-2024090080
item.description:
Report X-2024090080

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PLASTIC BUCKET WAS DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE GLOVES, BOOTS, GOGGLES, APRON, SILVER LINING WAS PUT ON AND DRUM WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW TUB/ DMP BAG. BUCKET WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL TUBS/PPE WAS THEN DECONTAMINATED AND BUCKET WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTO ETT.

item.title: Report E-2024090055
item.description:
Report E-2024090055

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-29
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately .25-gallons of deck king exterior vinyl contact adhesive released from metal can due to improper packaging (lid was opened) The release impacted in trailer#599-8010. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with the PPE available on site.
